metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8666 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The IP stack in the Linux kernel before 4.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (stack consumption and panic) or possibly have unspecified other impact by triggering use of the GRO path for packets with tunnel stacking, as demonstrated by interleaved IPv4 headers and GRE headers, a related issue to CVE-2016-7039.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8666` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-42-generic - 4.4.0-42.62
linux-image-4.4.0-42-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-42.62
linux-image-4.4.0-42-lowlatency - 4.4.0-42.62
linux-image-4.4.0-42-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-42.62
linux-image-4.4.0-42-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-42.62
linux-image-4.4.0-42-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-42.62
linux-image-4.4.0-42-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-42.62
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-42-generic - 4.4.0-42.62
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-42.62').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1027.33').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-42.62').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1030.33').
